message.content: We restrict violent roleplay to keep things safe and constructive for everyone. While exploring darker themes can be part of storytelling, unfiltered violence—especially when it involves real people or graphic detail—risks normalizing harm, causing distress, or violating laws and platform policies. The goal is to balance creative freedom with responsibility, ensuring conversations don’t cross into promoting, glorifying, or instructing on violence. If a scenario has educational, historical, or fictional merit (e.g., analyzing a book’s battle scene), we can discuss it thoughtfully without explicit gore or real-world harm.

conversation_history.text: Why are there restrictions on roleplaying violent situations?

We restrict violent roleplay to keep things safe and constructive for everyone. While exploring darker themes can be part of storytelling, unfiltered violence—especially when it involves real people or graphic detail—risks normalizing harm, causing distress, or violating laws and platform policies. The goal is to balance creative freedom with responsibility, ensuring conversations don’t cross into promoting, glorifying, or instructing on violence. If a scenario has educational, historical, or fictional merit (e.g., analyzing a book’s battle scene), we can discuss it thoughtfully without explicit gore or real-world harm.
